action.action-desc: Mr. Higgins of Louisiana (for himself, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Steube, Mr. Newhouse, and Mr. Gimenez) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor, and in addition to the Committee on the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To require the Attorney General and the Secretary of Education to conduct a survey of all public schools to determine the number of school resource officers at such schools.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the School Resource Officer Assessment Act of 2022.

Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Attorney General and the Secretary of Education shall jointly conduct and submit to Congress, a survey of the assignment of school resource officers at public elementary schools and secondary schools, which shall include a determination of whether each such school—

paragraph.text: on or after January 1, 2022, has been assigned a school resource officer; and
in the case of a school that has been assigned such an officer—

subparagraph.text: the number of such assignments; and
whether each such assignment is on a full-time or part-time basis.

paragraph.text: The terms elementary school and secondary school have the meanings given the terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The term school resource officer has the meaning given the term in section 1709(4) of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 (34 U.S.C. 10389(4)).
